variants.Description in input context: G309D mutation originally reported by Valente et al.
L347P mutation prevalent in the Philippines

Material used.Description: Cells were grown in Opti-MEM supplemented with 10% (vol/vol) FBS and were transiently transfected.

Readout description.Result Description: G309D had somewhat decreased activity (60.5% of wild type).
L347P had drastically decreased activity (<10% of wild type).

Biological replicates.Description: Data represent the means ± SEM from at least triplicate determinations.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type PINK1 was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: GST alone was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Differences in autophosphorylation activity between different recombinant proteins were analyzed by using ANOVA with Fisher's PLSD post hoc test.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Activity levels comparable to wild-type PINK1.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Activity levels significantly lower than wild-type PINK1.

Material used.Description: Cells were grown in Opti-MEM supplemented with 10% (vol/vol) FBS and were transiently transfected.

Readout description.Result Description: No effect was noted for G309D constructs on steady-state levels of transfected protein.
The amount of transfected PINK1 was drastically decreased by using the L347P mutant.

Biological replicates.Description: Data represent the means ± SEM from at least triplicate determinations.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type PINK1 was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Untransfected cells were used as a negative control.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Protein levels comparable to wild-type PINK1.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Protein levels significantly lower than wild-type PINK1.
